results.title: Dead or alive [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Takashi Miike, Ono Katsumi, Makoto Okada, Kimura Toshiki, Toei Animation and Daiei Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: Kinetic, ultra-violent and uber-cool feature from Japanese director Takashi Miike (Audition) was a hit in Japan immediately spawning a sequel. The narrative concerns the fortunes of a band of Yakuzas, drug trafficking and police attempts to stem the trade whilst engaging in brutal methods to achieve their aims. Narcotics cop Jojima, is on a mission to bring down Ryuichi, a Chinese born gangster. In perusing the case, Jojima faces great personal losses and is soon on a violent collision course with his archenemy. The script, by Ichiro Ryu, contains a youthful exuberance and a sadistically comic edge partnered with gruesome surreal murders and raw depictions of sex and drugs. Whilst the narrative features portraits of the many subcultures competing for space in the Japanese underworld, Miike favours broad depictions of character over complex profiles. But perhaps the reasons for engaging in Miike’s stylistic excesses has more to do with aesthetics in any case, as he utilises slow-motion photography and contrasts it with rapid editing to reflect the shifting, amoral gangster landscape where his protagonists roam. Cast includes: Riki Takeuchi, Sho Aikawa, Renji Ishibashi, Hirotaro Honda, Susumu Terajima and Tomoroh Taguchi.

results.title: Dead men don't wear plaid [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Carl Reiner, David V. Picker, William McEuen, Aspen Film Society and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Steve Martin is Rigby Reardon, the best private eye of all time. Juliet Forrest (Rachel Ward) comes to his office with a case. Her father, a noted scientist, philanthropist and cheesemaker has mysteriously died. A complex trail of clues leads Reardon to “Carlotta’s lists”. Reiner has captured the essence of 1940’s detective films and presents an exciting but “fun” film. Reardon’s special “friends” include Alan Ladd, Barbara Stanwyck, Ray Milland, Burt Lancaster, Humphrey Bogart and Charles Laughton.

results.title: Dead man walking
results.creator_credit: Tim Robbins, Rudd Simmons, John Kiuk, Havoc and Working Title Films
results.brief_description: In the role that won her an Academy Award, Susan Sarandon plays Sister Helen Prejean. Based on a true story and on the book written by Sister Prejean, the film deals with her relationship with convicted killer Matthew Poncelet. Convicted of the brutal murder of two teenagers, Poncelet waits on Death Row to end his life by lethal injection. Electing Sister Helen as his spiritual advisor, the film takes us on a journey from darkness into light as Matthew and Sister Prejean search for and face the truth. Robbins’ film is masterly and the performances of Sarandon and Sean Penn as Poncelot are compelling and moving. Robbins’ raises key issues in the film but never over-manipulates the audience to take one side or the other on the capital punishment issue.

results.title: Dead man [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, Demetra MacBride, Pandora Films and 12-Gauge Productions
results.brief_description: Filmed in stunning black and white by cinematographer Robby Muller, Jim Jarmusch has established a surreal tone for this visually poetic meditation on life and death. Dead Man is the tale of William Blake (Johnny Depp), a naive Ohio accountant who travels west to a primitive frontier outpost called Machine in expectation of a job that’s already been filled. Within a short space of time Blake is involved in a showdown and finds himself wounded and on the run. Pursued by vicious bounty hunters, Blake is looked after by Nobody (Gary Farmer) an Eastern-educated Indian who believes his new friend is the dead British poet and mystic William Blake. Gradually, Blake comes to fulfill his designated role as the most wanted man in this corner of the west, all the while preparing for life’s ultimate journey. Accompanied by the haunting music of Neil Young, cameo roles by Robert Mitchum, John Hurt and Iggy Pop, and a strong cast including Lance Henriksen, Michael Wincott, Mili Avital and Gabriel Byrne, makes Dead Man an experience not to be missed. Note: Widescreen format.

results.title: Dead man
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, Demetra MacBride, Pandora Filmproduktion and 12-Gauge Productions
results.brief_description:
Jarmusch establishes a surreal tone for this visually poetic and highly idiosyncratic meditation on life and death and the loss of innocence. ‘Dead Man’ is the tale of William Blake, a naïve Ohio accountant who travels west to a primitive frontier outpost called Machine in expectation of a job that’s already been filled. Within a short space of time Blake is involved in a showdown and finds himself wounded and on the run. Pursued by malevolent bounty hunters, and badly wounded, Blake is accompanied on his hallucinatory journey by Nobody - an Eastern educated Indian who believes his new friend is the dead British poet and mystic William Blake. Gradually, Blake comes to fulfil his designated role as the most wanted man in this corner of the west, all the while preparing for life’s ultimate journey aided by Native American spiritualism. Accompanied by the haunting music of Neil Young and filmed in tunning black and white by cinematographer Robby Muller, ‘Dead Man’ is a lyrical film that acts as mordant comment upon American life.

Credits: Producer, Demetra J. MacBride ; director, writer, Jim Jarmusch ; photography, Robby Muller ; music, Neil Young ; editing, Jay Rabinowitz.
Cast: Johnny Depp, Gary Farmer, Lance Henriksen, Lance Henriksen, Mili Avitlal, Michael Wincott.

results.title: Dead level
results.creator_credit: Ronald Haines and British Foundation Pictures
results.brief_description: This documentary presents the various skills and craftmanship that contribute to the manufacture of a billiard table. Beginning with the preparation of the slate table top which is cut and smoothed flat before the pocket areas are chiselled out; shows the trimming and fitting of the rubber edges and the application and of the felt table top cover; presents artisans involved in the design and construction phases; shows the various performance tests that are conducted during the manufacturing process; also captures the care taken when packing the table for shipment. Finally, Sidney Smith demonstrates both basic and novelty shots on a newly crafted table. Narrated by Frank Phillips.

results.title: Dead letter office
results.creator_credit: John Ruane, Denise Patience, Deb Cox, Steve Vizard, Andrew Knight and Artist Services
results.brief_description: In the dead letter office sit thousands of fading dreams which didn’t reach the recipient because they were insufficiently addressed. One batch of letters are signed by “your bundle of joy”, a young girl named Alice who writes regular letters to her absent father but keeps having them returned with the dead letter office stamp. Alice, now a young woman, begins a job with the dead letter office to continue searching for her father. Once there she encounters a box labelled “special cases”, a sealed collection of letters that the dead letter office doesn’t hold much hope for locating the recipient. Alice is drawn to these scribes like herself and becomes drawn into the misery of others, although her passion for these cases causes conflict amongst the other workers. The office is an odd assortment of employees, headed by manager Frank (George DelHoyo), a political refugee from Chile. Alice and Frank are drawn to each other and after appreciating one another’s dreams and tortured backgrounds, a tentative relationship develops in the most unlikeliest of settings. Cast includes Miranda Otto, George DelHoya, Nicholas Bell, Georgina Naidu, Syd Brisbane and Barry Otto.

results.title: Dead Heart (A) (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Nick Parsons, Helen Watts, Bryan Brown and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Constable Ray Lorkin (Bryan Brown) struggles to maintain law and order in the Aboriginal community of Wala Wala. The geographical isolation of the community is heightened by the incompatability between “white man’s justice” and indigenous tribal law. The situation reaches crisis point when a young Aboriginal (Aaron Pedersen) allows the white woman with whom he is having an affair to view a sacred initiation site. “Dead Heart” presents an honest portrayal of the conflict between two cultures and laws and the consequences that can occur. Parsons also wrote the script.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nick Parsons, Helen Watts, Bryan Brown and Film Finance Corporation Australia
